subject: Re: [junit] JUnit - httpunit vs htmlunit
msgSnippet: ... Personally I wouldn t use httpunit directly, but choose jWebUnit instead (http://jwebunit.sourceforge.net). This wrapper makes writing webtests feel much
messageBody:
thecyriuz82 wrote:

> Hi everybody,
>
> I'm new with JUnit and try to test my websites with one of the tools
> like httpunit or htmlunit. But unfortunately I don't really know
> which of them is better for testing?
> Can anybody tell me where are the main differences and in which case
> I should prefer one of this tools?

Personally I wouldn't use httpunit directly, but choose jWebUnit instead
(http://jwebunit.sourceforge.net). This 'wrapper' makes writing webtests
feel much more like using JUnit.

As for HTMLUnit, I have never worked with it, but from what I've read on
their pages, it sounds as an equal alternative for jWebUnit. Just try to
write some tests for a public website, like google and see which
framework you like most.

Hope to help,

Martijn Dashorst
